adept.kbapi

Class KBEntity

  • java.lang.Object
    • adept.kbapi.KBPredicateArgument
      • adept.kbapi.KBThing
        • adept.kbapi.KBEntity

  • public class KBEntity
extends KBThing
    The Class KBEntity represents an entity saved in the knowledge base. A KBEntity may have multiple entity types, with associated confidences.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • mergeKBEntities

        public static KBEntity mergeKBEntities(List<KBEntity> kbEntitiesToMerge,
                                       KB kb)
                                throws KBUpdateException,
                                       KBQueryException

        API to merge multiple KBEntities into a single KBEntity. Merging of KBEntities may be required, for example, when trying to remove duplicate entities (which point to the same real-world object--in other words, have the same externalKBIds)

        Current implementation of this method gets the most confident canonicalString and a weighted average of entity-type confidences from the contributing KBEntities. In case of multiple canonicalStrings with maximum confidence, one such string is chosen arbitrarily. The entity-type confidences are weighted by the number of provenances of the contributing KBEntity. The confidence of the merged entity is also a weighted average weighted by number of provenances of the entities being merged.

        The provenances of all the contributing KBEntities are re-linked to the merged entity. Re-linking simply means updating the KBId field of the contributing provenances in the TextProvenance table with the KBID of the merged entity.

        In this implementation, the merged-entity is not a new KBEntity, but a KBEntity chosen arbitrarily from the input list of KBEntities to merge. Specifically, it's the first KBEntity in the list. To reflect the merging, the confidence, canonicalString, canonicalMentionConfidence,entity-types map of the merged KBEntity are updated with new values.

        Currently, when deleting duplicate KBEntities, any relations or events they might be part of are not updated. This should change in a later version of the api.

        Parameters:
        kbEntitiesToMerge - List<KBEntity> of KBEntities to merge
        kb - KB instance
        Returns:
        the merged KBEntity
        Throws:
        KBUpdateException
        KBQueryException
